name: Wait....What Did He Just Sing? Quiz | Music | 10 Questions

questions.text:
"I've got the dynamo of volition the po-pole position.  Automatic transmission with lo-ow emissions.  I'm a brand new addition to the old edition with the love unconditional."

That is certainly a mouthful, and it is sung so insanely fast that I can never sing along with it.  Who sings it?
questions.explanation:
Jason Mraz.

	"The Dynamo of Volition" is a song of Jason Mraz's album "We Sing. We Dance. We Steal Things."  The album was released in 2008, and includes hit songs such as "I'm Yours", "The Remedy", and "Lucky" (featuring Colbie Caillat).

questions.text:
"Gonna make a break and take a fake I'd like the stinkin' achin' shake.  I like vanilla, it's the finest of the flavors.  Gotta see the show 'cause then you'll know the vertigo is gonna grow 'cause it's so dangerous, you'll have to sign a waiver."

I never was able to understand this line, since it was sung so fast, as it the entire song, so I printed out the lyrics and learned it; and can now sing it from memory.  Now, the artist is the Barenaked Ladies, but what is the song?
questions.explanation:
One Week.

	"One Week" was the first single of the Barenaked Ladies' album "Stunt", which was released in 2008.  Interestingly enough, the song spent 'one week' at number one on the charts. "One Week" refers to a lot of brands, people, movies, etc.  Below is a list of what they mention in the order they are mentioned.  :-) HoodwinkAquamanChalet SwissLeAnn RimesBert KaemfertChickity ChinaX-FilesDans la MaisonSmoking ManHarrison FordFranticStingTantricSnickersKurasawaSailor MoonBirchmount StadiumRobbie

questions.text:
"You can't imagine the immensity of the stuff I'm not giving, about your money and man servant at the mansion you live in.  And I don't want to go places where all my ladies can't get in.  Just grab a bottle, some boys, and let's take it back to my basement."

This song is by Ke$ha, and is insanely fast.  But what song is it, anyway?
questions.explanation:
Sleazy.

	"Sleazy" is a song from Ke$ha's 2010 album "Cannibal", her second album.  Her first album was called "Animal".  The song only made it to 51 on the Billboard Hot 100, but was 46 on the Canadian Hot 100.

questions.text:
"Something grabs a hold of me tightly, flow like a harpoon daily and nightly.  Will it ever stop you, I don't know.  Turn off the lights and I'll glow.  To the extreme I rock the mic like a vandal.  Light up the stage and wax a chump like a candle.  Dance to rush to the speaker that booms.  I'm killing your brain like a poisonous mushroom.  Deadly when I play a dope medley".

I couldn't figure out what this singer was saying when he rapped those words so fast.  I had to think "Wait... what did he just sing?"  Who was this one-hit wonder who sang the song?
questions.explanation:
Vanilla Ice.

	"Ice Ice Baby" was released in 1990 on Vanilla Ice's album "To the Extreme".  The song was also the first hip hop song to reach number one on the charts.

questions.text:
"It starts with one thing I don't know why.  It doesn't even matter how hard I try.  Keep that in mind, I designed this rhyme to explain in due time that all I know time is a valuable thing.  Watch it fly by as the pendulum swings.  Watch it count down to the end of the day.  The clock ticks life away."

Who sings the song "In the End", as seen above?
questions.explanation:
Linkin Park.

	"In the End" was released in 2001 on Linkin Park's album "Hybrid Theory", which was their first.  Though it wasn't their first single on the album, it was one of their most popular songs, reaching number two on the Billboard Hot 100.

questions.text:
"I got a pocket, got a pocketful of sunshine.  I got a love and I know that it's all mine.  Oh, oh oh oh.  Do what you want but you're never gonna break me.  Sticks and stones are never gonna shake me.  Oh, oh oh oh.  Take me away, a secret place, a sweet escape, take me away."

These lyrics are often hard to understand simply because they are so fast.  Who sings them?
questions.explanation:
Natasha Bedingfield.

	Natasha Bedingfield released the album "N.B." in 2007, but later re-released the album under the title "Pocketful of Sunshine" in Canada and the United States.  The song "Pocketful of Sunshine" was not on "N.B." but only on "Pocketful of Sunshine".  The song can also be found on her album "Strip Me Away".

questions.text:
"Wear them gold and diamond rings.  All them things don't mean a thing.  Chaperons and limousines.  Shopping for expensive things.  I be on the movie screens, magazines and bougie scenes.  I'm not clean, I'm not pristine, I'm no queen, I'm no machine."

That song is "G-L-A-M-O-R-O-U-S!"  Who sings that song?
questions.explanation:
Fergie.

	"Glamorous" is a song on Fergie's debut album "The Dutchess", released in 2006.  The song was released as a single in 2007.  The album also contains her hits "Fergalicious", "Clumsy", and "Big Girls Don't Cry".  She is also one of the singers of the Black Eyed Peas.

questions.text:
"Mad 'cause I'm getting money in abundance.  Man I can't even count all these hundreds.  Duffle bag every time I go to Sun Trust.  I leave the rest just to collect interest, I mean interest.  My nemesis, exclamation just for emphasis.  And I don't sympathize 'cause you a simple simple.  I just pop up like some pimple pimple.  And put an iron to your face, you're all wrinkle wrinkle."

Nicki Minaj sings a lot of songs super fast.  Who does she sing this song with?
questions.explanation:
Will.i.am

	"Check it Out" was released in 2010 as a single by Will.i.am and Nicki Minaj, and was later included on Nicki Minaj's album "Pink Friday", released in 2010.  Nicki Minaj sings songs with a lot of others, including "Bottles Up" with Trey Songz, "2012" with Jay Sean, "My Chick Bad" with Ludacris, "BedRock" with Young Money and Lloyd, and "Moment 4 Life", among many others.

questions.text:
"When I was 13 I had my first love.  There was nobody that compared to my baby, and nobody came between us who could ever come above.  She had me going crazy, oh I was starstruck.  She woke me up daily, don't need no Starbucks.  She made my heart pound.  I skip a beat when I see her in the street and at school on the playground.  But I really wanna see her on the weekend."

Justin Bieber sings the song along with Ludacris.  What song is it?
questions.explanation:
Baby.

	"Baby" was one of Justin Bieber's many singles on his second album "My World 2.0", which was released in 2010, just a few months after his 2009 release of "My World".  Justin Bieber sang "Eenie Meenie" with Sean Kingston, "Somebody to Love" with Usher, and "Never Say Never" with Jaden Smith.

questions.text:
"We talk about your work how your boss is a jerk.  We talk about your church and your head when it hurts.  We talk about your troubles you've been having with your brother, about your daddy and your mother and your crazy ex-lover.  We talk about your friends and the places that you've been.  We talk about your skin and the dimples on your chin.  The polish on your toes and the run in your hose, and God knows we're gonna talk about your clothes."

This is a fast-paced country song that makes me often think "Wait... what did he just say?" because I cannot understand what he is singing sometimes.  Who sings it?
questions.explanation:
Toby Keith.

	Toby Keith sang "I Wanna Talk About Me" was released in 2001 as a single from his album "Pull My Chain".  It was his seventh single on the Billboard Hot Country Singles and Tracks chart.  It is classified as a country-rap song because of its upbeat and fast pace, and was the first "country-rap" song to reach number one on Billboard charts.
